The hacker who goes by the pseudonym “Guccifer 2.0” has announced plans to release a “dossier” on Democratic Rep. Ben Ray Lujan that allegedly was among documents stolen from the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee (DCCC).

(RELATED: Leaked Emails Show DNC Officials Constructing Anti-Bernie Narrative)

Several leading DNC officials, including then-DNC chair Debbie Wasserman Schultz, were forced to resign as a result of the hacked documents.
The hacker, who is widely believed to have Russian ties, has previously released emails from the Democratic National Committee (DNC), as well as some internal DCCC documents.
Although Guccifer 2.0 has previously released documents to WikiLeaks and news organizations, he indicated plans to publish the dossier on his personal website.

(RELATED: WikiLeaks Releases Nearly 20,000 Hacked DNC Emails)

In July, WikiLeaks published nearly 20,000 emails stolen from the DNC by Guccifer 2.0.
Among other things, the email dump showed DNC officials colluding against Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders in the Democratic primary.
